Q0:
DESCRIPTION:  You are invited to participate in a research study evaluating patients’ perspectives and usage of AI-based language models in their clinical care. You will be asked to answer questions about if you have used AI large language models, which AI large language models you have used, how you have used AI large language models, and demographic information about you. All survey responses are captured anonymously. 

TIME INVOLVEMENT:  Your participation will take approximately 15 minutes.

RISKS AND BENEFITS:  The risks associated with this study are no foreseeable risks associated with completing this survey. We cannot and do not guarantee or promise that you will receive any benefits from completing this survey. However, by completing this survey, you will be contributing to our understanding of how patients are using AI language models in their clinical care. Your decision whether or not to participate in this study will not affect your employment or clinical care.

PAYMENTS:  You will not receive any payment for completing this survey.



PARTICIPANT'S RIGHTS:  If you have read this form and have decided to participate in this project, please understand your participation is voluntary and you have the right to withdraw your consent or discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits to which you are otherwise entitled.  The alternative is not to participate.  You have the right to refuse to answer particular questions.  The results of this research study may be presented at scientific or professional meetings or published in scientific journals.  Your individual privacy will be maintained in all published and written data resulting from the study. All survey responses will be recorded anonymously.

CONTACT INFORMATION: 
Questions:  If you have any questions, concerns or complaints about this research, its procedures, risks and benefits, contact the Protocol Director, Dr. Roxana Daneshjou at 650-723-6316.You should also contact them at any time if you feel you have been hurt by being a part of this study.

Independent Contact:  If you are not satisfied with how this study is being conducted, or if you have any concerns, complaints, or general questions about the research or your rights as a participant, please contact the Stanford Institutional Review Board (IRB) to speak to someone independent of the research team at 650-723-5244 or toll free at 1-866-680-2906.  You can also write to the Stanford IRB, Stanford University, 1705 El Camino Real, Palo Alto, CA 94306.

Please print a copy of this page for your records.

If you agree to participate in this research, please click on the “Agree” button.

Q19: Please share any stories or additional information about your use of large language models for healthcare. Please DO NOT include any of your personal information such as name or contact information.
Often use chat gpt as sir of a meta analysis on any potential issues

I have several systemic autoimmune issues, endometriosis and related issues, and IBS.  I use ChatGPT (without my account logged in) to see if there could be connections between my symptoms and diseases and have actually found useful ideas which I then researched articles from reliable sources because of the results.
Asked about rehabilitation of severe muscle strain or tearing in the quads and was given a reasonable regiment that included icing, stretching, low impact activity and such
not sure which questions to ask. i feel like if i as the right question the better the answer will be.

I had an allergic reaction to an agave plant while gardening. Within 24 hours, red spots and open sores appeared on my arms and legs. I sent a picture to chatGPT and asked about it. It suggested the situation was more serious than I expected and recommended I go to a doctor. Its response influenced my decision to go to Urgent Care and to receive treatment.
It seems good for interpreting medical-ese test results obtained prior to seeing a doctor.
One of many examples is that I was unable to urinate after a severe urinary infection and ChatGPT was incredibly helpful helping me re-learn how to synchronize breathing with urination
